name: SKRenderer
desc: An object that renders a scene into a custom Metal rendering pipeline and drives the scene update cycle.

items.name: init(device: MTLDevice)
items.desc: Initializes with a specific GPU to render into.

items.name: var scene: SKScene?
items.desc: The scene this renderer will draw into the Metal command buffer.

items.name: func render(withViewport: CGRect, commandBuffer: MTLCommandBuffer, renderPassDescriptor: MTLRenderPassDescriptor)
func render(withViewport: CGRect, renderCommandEncoder: MTLRenderCommandEncoder, renderPassDescriptor: MTLRenderPassDescriptor, commandQueue: MTLCommandQueue)
var showsNodeCount: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays an overlay that shows physics bodies that are visible in the scene.

items.name: var showsDrawCount: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays the number of drawing passes it needed to render the view.

items.name: var showsQuadCount: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays the number of rectangles used to render the scene.

items.name: var showsPhysics: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays physics-related debugging information.

items.name: var showsFields: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays information about physics fields in the scene.
